analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the method of the Triads and Duces

The triad of the wholesome, the triad of the unwholesome, the triad of the indeterminate, the duce of the wholesome, the duce of the unwholesome, the duce of the indeterminate, the duce of the wholesome and the indeterminate, the duce of the unwholesome and the indeterminate, the duce of the wholesome, the unwholesome and the indeterminate.

original: Nakusalaṁ nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naakusalaṁ nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na kusalam na sauttaram dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ sauttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na akusalam na sauttaram dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ sauttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Conditioned by a wholesome, unwholesome and indeterminate phenomenon there arises an indeterminate phenomenon, a resultant, a non-causally-originated, a wholesome, an unwholesome, a wholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon, a wholesome, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon.🔽Conditioned by a wholesome, unwholesome and indeterminate phenomenon there arises a wholesome phenomenon, a resultant, a non-causally-originated, an unwholesome, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon, a wholesome, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon.

original: Naabyākataṁ nasauttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naakusalaṁ nasauttarañca naabyākataṁ nasauttarañca dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato sauttaro
analyzed: na abyākatam na sauttaram dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ sauttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  na akusalam na sauttaram ca na abyākatam na sauttaram ca dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ sauttaro
translated: Conditioned by a wholesome, unwholesome and indeterminate phenomenon there arises an unwholesome phenomenon, a resultant, a non-causally-originated, a wholesome, a wholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon, an unwholesome, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nakusalaṁ nasauttarañca naakusalaṁ nasauttarañca dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na kusalam na sa uttarañca na akusalam na sa uttarañca dhamma
translated: Conditioned by a wholesome, unwholesome and indeterminate phenomenon there arises an indeterminate phenomenon, a resultant, a non-causally-originated, a wholesome, an unwholesome, a wholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon, a wholesome, an unwholesome and an indeterminate phenomenon.

original: paṭicca abyākato sauttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca,
analyzed: paṭicca abyākataḥ sauttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca
translated: (In brief.) In the section on root-cause there are five;

original: adhipatiyā pañca …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: adhipatiyā pañca pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: in the section on predominance there are five; … in the section on kamma-result there are three; … in the section on dissociation there are five.

original: Nakusalaṁ naanuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kusalo anuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: na kusalam na anuttaram dhammam paccayā kusalaḥ anuttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: “With a profitable, not-supreme, idea as condition, a profitable, supreme, idea arises, by way of root-cause condition. … (In brief.) “With a root-cause, six … “With an action, three … “With an unprompted, six …
